verses.verse: Havahn to day <S%H3117><s%> is my complaint <S%H7879><s%> bitter <S%H4805><s%>: my stroke <S%H3027><s%> is heavier <S%H3513><s%> <S%H8804><s%> than my groaning <S%H585><s%>.

Oh that <S%H5414><s%> <S%H8799><s%> I knew <S%H3045><s%> <S%H8804><s%> where I might find <S%H4672><s%> <S%H8799><s%> him! that I might come <S%H935><s%> <S%H8799><s%> even to his seat <S%H8499><s%> !
I would order <S%H6186><s%> <S%H8799><s%> my cause <S%H4941><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> him, and fill <S%H4390><s%> <S%H8762><s%> my mouth <S%H6310><s%> with arguments <S%H8433><s%>.

I would know <S%H3045><s%> <S%H8799><s%> the words <S%H4405><s%> which he would answer <S%H6030><s%> <S%H8799><s%> me, and understand <S%H995><s%> <S%H8799><s%> what he would say <S%H559><s%> <S%H8799><s%> unto me.
Will he plead <S%H7378><s%> <S%H8799><s%> against <S%H5978><s%> me with his great <S%H7230><s%> power <S%H3581><s%>? No; but he would put <S%H7760><s%> <S%H8799><s%> strength in me.

There the righteous <S%H3477><s%> might dispute <S%H3198><s%> <S%H8737><s%> with him; so should I be delivered <S%H6403><s%> <S%H8762><s%> for ever <S%H5331><s%> from my judge <S%H8199><s%> <S%H8802><s%>.
Behold, I go <S%H1980><s%> <S%H8799><s%> forward <S%H6924><s%>, but he is not there; and backward <S%H268><s%>, but I cannot perceive <S%H995><s%> <S%H8799><s%> him:

On the left hand <S%H8040><s%>, where he doth work <S%H6213><s%> <S%H8800><s%>, but I cannot behold <S%H2372><s%> <S%H8799><s%> him: he hideth <S%H5848><s%> <S%H8799><s%> himself on the right hand <S%H3225><s%>, that I cannot see <S%H7200><s%> <S%H8799><s%> him:

But he knoweth <S%H3045><s%> <S%H8804><s%> the way <S%H1870><s%> that I take <S%H5978><s%>: when he hath tried <S%H974><s%> <S%H8804><s%> me, I shall come forth <S%H3318><s%> <S%H8799><s%> as gold <S%H2091><s%>.
My foot <S%H7272><s%> hath held <S%H270><s%> <S%H8804><s%> his steps <S%H838><s%>, his way <S%H1870><s%> have I kept <S%H8104><s%> <S%H8804><s%>, and not declined <S%H5186><s%> <S%H8686><s%>.

Neither have I gone back <S%H4185><s%> <S%H8686><s%> from the Mitzvah <S%H4687><s%> of his lips <S%H8193><s%>; I have esteemed <S%H6845><s%> <S%H8804><s%> the words <S%H561><s%> of his mouth <S%H6310><s%> more than my necessary <S%H2706><s%> food.

But he is in one <S%H259><s%> mind, and who can turn <S%H7725><s%> <S%H8686><s%> him? and what his soul <S%H5315><s%> desireth <S%H183><s%> <S%H8765><s%>, even that he doeth <S%H6213><s%> <S%H8799><s%>.
For he performeth <S%H7999><s%> <S%H8686><s%> the thing that is appointed <S%H2706><s%> for me: and many <S%H7227><s%> such <S%H2007><s%> things are with him.
Therefore am I troubled <S%H926><s%> <S%H8735><s%> at his presence <S%H6440><s%>: when I consider <S%H995><s%> <S%H8709><s%>, I am afraid <S%H6342><s%> <S%H8799><s%> of him.
For 'Elohim <S%H410><s%> maketh my heart <S%H3820><s%> soft <S%H7401><s%> <S%H8689><s%>, and 'El SHaddai <S%H7706><s%> troubleth <S%H926><s%> <S%H8689><s%> me:

Because I was not cut off <S%H6789><s%> <S%H8738><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> the darkness <S%H2822><s%>, neither hath he covered <S%H3680><s%> <S%H8765><s%> the darkness <S%H652><s%> from my face <S%H6440><s%>.
